Messages.Author: Carlos Enrique Améndola Cerón
Messages.Content: Dear course participants, as announced during the lecture, we will be opening registrations for the oral exam of the course. This consists of two steps: 1) Choose your preferred time slot here (opens tomorrow, 08:00 am) 2) Fill out the (first section of the) registration form and send it by email to niessen@math.tu-berlin.de  Your registration is only complete when both steps are done. If you are interested in taking the exam, we ask you to follow them as soon as possible. Best wishes, CA

Messages.Author: Carlos Enrique Améndola Cerón
Messages.Content: Dear all,  due to popular demand, we are offering additional slots on Tuesday, August 20th.  Feel free to update your preferences if the date suits you better.  Best,  CA

Messages.Author: Carlos Enrique Améndola Cerón
Messages.Content: Dear course participants: Please seriously consider helping out on the next Mathematics Day to take place at TU on May 4th.  For more info, see the message from the organization team below. ----------------- Helfer:innen gesucht!  Unser Institut richtet am Samstag, dem 4. Mai, den 27. Tag der Mathematik aus: https://www3.math.tu-berlin.de/TDM/tdm-2024/ Wir benötigen Dutzende studentische Helfer für Aufsicht, Korrektur und technische Vortragshilfe! Hauptsächlich brauche ich Aufsichtspersonen, die den Wettbewerb durchzuführen helfen. Es haben sich schon 330 Schüler(innen) zum Wettbewerb angemeldet, und ich rechne mit etwa tausend am Ende. Jede(r) Hilfswillige muss einfach nur zu https://www3.math.tu-berlin.de/TDM/tdm-2024/ gehen und  sich links unten eintragen unter Intern -> Unterstützung vor Ort Meldungen sehr gerne an tdm@math.tu-berlin.de.  Herzlichen Dank und beste Grüße, Wolfgang König (für das TdM-Orgateam) ----------------- May the 4th be with you! CA

Messages.Author: Carlos Enrique Améndola Cerón
Messages.Content: Dear course participants, It was good to meet some of you today! While the exercise session for the course is set for Wednesday afternoons (starting from April 24, 2024), to set the schedule for the tutorium we ask you to please register on MOSES as soon as possible, so we know the best slot that works for the majority.  Best wishes and hope to see you tomorrow, Carlos A. and Janike O.

Messages.Author: Anna Sergeeva
Messages.Content: Hello,   unfortunately I didnt register for the tutorium on moses. Am I still able to participate in this course or was registration on moses a mandatory? thank you

Messages.Author: Janike Oldekop
Messages.Content: You are very welcome in both the lecture and the tutorial! If you send me your student number via email I can officially register you for the tutorial in Moses.

Messages.Author: Anna Popkova
Messages.Content: Hallo! I created a WhatsApp group for the Discrete Geometry course. You are welcome to join through this link:): https://chat.whatsapp.com/I4k48C9rSaBK4FPuJcpUwi

Messages.Author: Max Nicolas Dahlinger
Messages.Content: In yesterdays lecture I asked whether we could create texed lecture notes based on this semesters lectures. Prof. Améndola was open to the idea and therefore I wanted to ask, whether anyone else would be interested to help in this endeavor? I have created an overleaf project and am nearly done texing yesterdays lecture. This is the read-only-link to the project https://www.overleaf.com/read/qkfzpzjxgvnk#1db43e. Anyone who wants to help in creating the lecture notes, dm me and I will add you as a collaborator. As soon as there is at least one other person, I will create a Telegram Group (and post the link to join in a reply to this message) where we can discuss changes/suggestions for the document etc. or other matters relating to this course.

Messages.Author: Carlos Enrique Améndola Cerón
Messages.Content: Thank you Max for such a nice initiative and for getting started with this project! (particularly for including better diagrams than the ones I could draw on the board). I very much hope that more people are interested in joining you and that this takes off. Every participant should seriously consider collaborating so that everybody can benefit from it.
